noun.description: A person's essential being that distinguishes them from others, especially considered as the object of introspection or reflexive action.
examples: our alienation from our true selves
guilt can be turned against the self
language is an aspect of a person's sense of self

adjective.description: (of a trimming or cover) of the same material and color as the rest of the item.

examples: a variety that selfs itself loses lots of vigor in the progeny

origin: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zelf and German selbe. Early use was emphatic, expressing the sense (I) myself, (he) himself, etc. The verb dates from the early 20th century.
